The President receives a salary of $400,000 / year, with an expense allowance of $169,000 / year. The Pope does not receive a salary for his position. In fact, because Pope Francis specifically has made a vow of poverty, he is unable to own any property other than that which he is custodian of by virtue of being the Bishop of Rome. Other popes who have not made a vow of poverty are free to receive a salary, and Pope Emeritus Benedict has a pension of 24000 euros / yr. The Pope does have access to hundreds of millions of dollars each year, which are intended for charitable use and Church activities. None of that money is to benefit the Pope personally. The Church as a whole ensures that all of the Pope's needs in terms of clothing, shelter, and food are provided. So the Pope's salary is non-existent, his pension is about 1/10th the size, and his allowance is hundreds of times greater.
